result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan J Llorens-Caraballo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan J Llorens-Caraballo not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Juan J Llorens-Caraballo.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  State will file an Order to Produce.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Juan J Llorens-Caraballo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Juan J Llorens-Caraballo.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Officer W. Kunkel. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No driving during pendency of case.

Defendant Juan J Llorens-Caraballo appeared by video, in custody at MSDF.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Juan J Llorens-Caraballo.  Attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
